III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12505 – Supervision.
Section • (2) An agency shall provide supervision for a youth in
Description independent living consistent with the youth’s need for
supervision, as required by R 400.12504(2)(e).
1

• (b) At monthly intervals, ensure that the youth is
complying with the terms of the contract required by
R 400.12510. continues to reside in a safe and
acceptable environment, and is managing
expenditures.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Placement had maggots in the home and mold in the basement.
Investigation The complaint was received 08/07/2023. There was no identified
complainant as a part of complaint.
Interviews:
I interviewed Youth A by telephone on 10/12/2023 and Youth A
confirmed the mold/mildew carpeting had been removed from the
laundry area.
A Placement Collaboration Unit (PCU) conference was completed
on 8/11/2023 with this consultant, State Worker 1 and Program
Manager 1. Program Manager 1 is the current worker for Youth A.
During the meeting I interviewed Program Manager 1 regarding
the allegations. Program Manager 1 stated the maggots were the
result of program youth leaving some food under the bed in the
youth's room. Program Manager 1 stated the spoiled food was
removed when it was discovered and the area under the bed was
swept and cleaned. Program Manager 1 stated the youth were
subsequently provided additional training/direction regarding the
proper disposal of food when it is taken to a youth's room.
Program Manager 1 stated the mold in the basement was not
black mold but was mildew in the carpeting around the laundry
area in the basement. Program Manager 1 stated the agency
contracts with the owner of the building and a request for
maintenance had already been submitted to the landlord to correct
the problem. Program Manager 1 also stated the agency has a
pest control service to come into the building on a monthly basis
to complete an inspection. I requested documentation from
Program Manager 1 to confirm the pest control services and
maintenance request for the landlord. This documentation was
subsequently received 08/15/2023. I also requested
documentation regarding the completion of the maintenance
request related to the mold/mildew in the basement laundry area
Documents Reviewed:
2

• A maintenance request related to the alleged mold/mildew
was sent on 6/06/2023. The documentation noted that
someone was to be at the building between 12:00-4:00 PM
that same day.
• Picture documentation was received 09/20/2023 to confirm
the carpeting had been removed from the basement
laundry area. The pictures confirmed the carpet with
mold/mildew had been removed.
• A statement was also received to confirm the ongoing
services being provided by a pest control company.
Analysis The findings of this investigation indicate the agency responded in
a timely manner when the environmental complaints were
reported/discovered. The agency has a pest control service come
into the building on a regular basis to help with maintenance pest
control. The agency also provided the residents with additional
training/direction on how to appropriately dispose of unused food
to maintain a safe/acceptable environment on an ongoing basis.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
